cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 195 miles ESE of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: expected to slow, then turn northwest and move very slowly toward the southeastern Louisiana‒Mississippi coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just east of the mouth of the Mississippi River, southeastern Louisiana

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch from the Mississippi/Alabama border to the Alabama/Florida border
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from Morgan City, LA, to Ocean Springs, MS, including Lake Pontchartrain & Lake Maurepas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana through the western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (≥39 mph) expected Monday, with hurricane-force gusts possible as the center nears; prolonged due to slow motion.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Life-threatening surge of 4–7 ft possible at and east of the Mississippi River mouth, including Plaquemines Parish.
weather_observation.rainfall: 8–16 inches with isolated 24 inches possible, producing significant flash flooding and river flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes beginning Monday afternoon; dangerous surf and rip currents.
